question: 鮭
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
The reading for this vocabulary is the same as the reading you learned with the kanji. But! Some explanation about when to use <ja>さけ</ja> versus <ja>しゃけ</ja>.

They're both technically right. But, typically when you refer to the living animal, you use <ja>さけ</ja>, and when you refer to salmon as a food, it's more likely to be <ja>しゃけ</ja> (but it can go either way). There might be some generational and regional differences, though.
